result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

10:58 AM Defendant Ronald D Hendrickson in court with Attorney Kathleen Chung.  ADA Lexi Keyes in court for the State of Wisconsin. Sarah Thomford from Dane County Pretrial Services appeared in the Courtroom. 
Re: Motion for Reduction of Cash Bail
Statement in support of Motion by Attorney Chung. Objection to Signature by ADA Keyes and request for cash bail to be required. Statement by Sarah Thomford. Motion to Modify Bail is Denied. All conditions remain the same.

and returned.

Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 9/19/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _X_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol.
_x_ Regardless of when cash bail (if required) is posted, or when a signature bond is signed, the jail shall only release the defendant if the defendant can arrive at Pretrial Services between the hours of 8 am and 3 pm (Monday through Friday) unless the jail has cleared a later arrival time directly with Pretrial Services. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services

Defendant taken into custody.

Per Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS) violation report, Court orders bench warrant issued. 
If the Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCPS. If the Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCPS is required to enforce conditions of release and the Defendant shall report to DCPS by 10:00 a.m. on the business day following release from jail. All other bail conditions remain set.
